title: Fiora's Ultimate...
body: There is almost a 50/50 chance of it not proccing the healing part of her ultimate. Generally, if I ult someone and it's been on them for roughly 3+ seconds, it's guaranteed to work, but any shorter and it won't. I've put it on someone within half a second before they even die, I've put it on them and auto attacked one of the vitals, then Q'd the other which killed them, but it happened so fast, my ult still doesn't proc the heal. It's extremely irritating...

replies.body: Did you proc at least one vital on the ultimate? When the target dies with Fiora ult on, it requires Fiora to have proc at least one vital to leave behind a healing zone. I totally though it was broken until I read the tooltip

I'm no expert, but from my experience playing Fiora it seems like there is a pretty sizable delay between using her ultimate on someone and the vitals actually appearing.  

I'm assuming this is either a balance thing (can't instantly burst someone down) or a mistake, but it ends up feeling really bad for the fiora if she ults right before an autoattack and can't hit a vital, making her ultimate do literally nothing if the target dies shortly after.

Only one of them works and only one's supposed to be lit up, in case you're going to try and rebuttal with them being my ult..

Not only have I had this happen (I feel like the vitals must not be strikeable right away). But it also feels like, if you lunge too close to the center of their character model, you end up INSIDE the vitals and don't hit any.  That could be an illusion, but I swear it feels like it happens)
